alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Johnson; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 10:48AM EST until March 11 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Driftwood River near Edinburgh. East Fork White River from Columbus to Bedford. .Minor flooding will continue or develop along portions of the Driftwood, East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers for the next several days. Flooding is occurring due to significant rainfall which occurred last weekend. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The high water situation is likely to begin to improve along northern reaches of the main stem rivers within the next few days, while flooding will last longer further south. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Driftwood River near Edinburgh. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.2 feet, Lowland flooding in progress along Driftwood River in northern Bartholomew County on April 6, 2011. Double Y Saddle Club area flooded. At least 6 inches of water flowing over CR 950N to Club. Water is less than one foot away from CR 330W just south of its intersection with Ohio Ridge Rd. CR 500N west of CR 250W is flooded blocking vehicular access to residences near the river bank. Lowell Public Access site is open but ramp is totally flooded. Water close to one residence at Shelby CR 1000S and CR 900W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Wednesday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 4.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1100 PM EST.
